content.raw:
Thank you for addressing all the comments. LGTM.

I just pushed a change on c005caa so that going back to the initial pose woks even when `<camera_pose>` is not given. You can test this by loading the `empty.sdf` world, opening the view angles plugin, and clicking on the home. Before that change, the camera would go to the world origin, which is a bit awkward.
content.html:
Thank you for addressing all the comments. LGTM.

I just pushed a change on c005caa so that going back to the initial pose woks even when <camera_pose> is not given. You can test this by loading the empty.sdf world, opening the view angles plugin, and clicking on the home. Before that change, the camera would go to the world origin, which is a bit awkward.

content.raw: :thumbsup:
Works for me! I just have some comments below.
content.html: Works for me! I just have some comments below.

content.raw: Do we need all the `Ripple` elements? I removed them and the only difference I noticed is that the button doesn't look active after clicked, is that why they were added? I think that we don't need to keep the button "checked" after the user presses it, because once the user starts orbiting around the scene, that button check is no longer representative of the camera state. What do you think?
content.html: Do we need all the Ripple elements? I removed them and the only difference I noticed is that the button doesn't look active after clicked, is that why they were added? I think that we don't need to keep the button "checked" after the user presses it, because once the user starts orbiting around the scene, that button check is no longer representative of the camera state. What do you think?

content.raw: These docs are not very accurate. The XYZ actually correspond to the direction vector, and a zero vector means the initial pose
content.html: These docs are not very accurate. The XYZ actually correspond to the direction vector, and a zero vector means the initial pose

content.raw: I think we don't need some of these includes, like the `ignition/gazebo` ones
content.html: I think we don't need some of these includes, like the ignition/gazebo ones

content.raw: Just a suggestion to keep the API consistent, how about calling this `OnViewAngleComplete`?
content.html: Just a suggestion to keep the API consistent, how about calling this OnViewAngleComplete?
